intro: Eschscholzia papastillii, commonly known as the Papastill's poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes various species of poppies. The plant features showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. This species is adapted to rocky and dry habitats, showcasing its resilience in arid environments.
